resources.string: Thank you for joining this user testing!
This evaluation is a part of the Master’s thesis titled: “Optimizing mobile map reading: An adaptive map approach in response to dynamic pedestrian context”.
Your feedback will help to understand the impact of the dynamic context factors on the mobile map reading process and improve mobile maps in the future!
1. You will be given a short survey (3 questions): this will help us understand your background and experience a bit better.

2. We will ask you to complete twice one map-related task followed by one question. Don’t worry you will have as much time as you need to solve the task and answer the question. There are no bad or good answers but it’s important that you exactly follow the instructions.
3. We will give you another short survey (4 questions) that will help us gather your feedback after solving the tasks.
We’ll repeat this process at three different locations. Don’t worry we’ll take you there!
Please read the questions carefully and follow the instructions!
Feel free to ask any questions you might have before starting the test. If everything is clear, you’re ready to begin!
3. How often do you use mobile maps?
Imagine you’re a tourist who came for a weekend trip to Vienna. Unfortunately, you’re not feeling good and you need to find a pharmacy to buy some medicines.
Your task: Click on the icon representing the closest pharmacy from your location.
Keep on walking while solving the task, you don’t have to rush but you cannot stop!
Remember that whenever you stop, a warning message will be displayed. If that happens don’t worry! Just follow the instructions on the screen.
You can put on the headphones now
How confident are you that you completed this task successfully?
Imagine you’re a tourist who came to Vienna for a weekend trip and you’re interested in exploring some of the museums in your area.
Your task: Click on the icon representing the closest museum from your location.
Keep on walking while solving the task, you don’t have to rush but you cannot stop!
Remember that whenever you stop, a warning message will be displayed. If that happens don’t worry! Just follow the instructions on the screen.
1. How familiar were you with the testing area?
2. Which of the two maps do you believe was more helpful to solve the task?
3. Did you encounter any difficulties understanding the tasks or completing them?
If yes, please describe the difficulties you encountered.
4. Were there any issues with the app itself (e.g. slow performance, unexpected behavior, unintuitive user interface) that you think may have affected your answers?
If yes, please describe the specific issue with the app.
Now you will be taken to the second location. No need to do anything for now.
Once you’re there press “Next” to continue the second part of the user evaluation.
Don’t close the application, just block the screen.
Imagine you’re in a rush to catch public transport. You’re worried about the unexpected delays that might slow you down on the way, like waiting to cross the street.
Your task: Click on the icon representing the closest traffic signal from your location.
You have to run while solving the task! Only after solving the task, you should stop. You can also stop to click on the icon once you found it.
Remember that whenever you stop or slow down, a warning message will be displayed. If that happens don’t worry! Just follow the instructions on the screen.
Imagine you’re in a rush to catch public transport. You want to know which way to go to the nearest bus stop.
Your task: Click on the icon representing the closest bus stop from your location.
You have to run while solving the task! Only after solving the task, you should stop. You can also stop to click on the icon once you found it.
Remember that whenever you stop or slow down, a warning message will be displayed. If that happens don’t worry! Just follow the instructions on the screen.
Now you will be taken to the last location. No need to do anything for now.
Once you’re there press “Next” to continue the last part of the user evaluation.
Don’t close the application, just block the screen.
Imagine you went for a walk in the park and you’re trying to find toilets.
Your task: Click on the icon representing the closest toilet from your location.
Keep on walking while solving the task, you don’t have to rush but you cannot stop walking!
Remember that whenever you stop, a warning message will be displayed. If that happens don’t worry! Just follow the instructions on the screen.
Imagine you went for a walk in the park and you want to find out whether there are any places where you could practice some sport.
Your task: Click on the icon representing the closest area to practice sport from your location.
Keep on walking while solving the task, you don’t have to rush but you cannot stop walking!
Remember that whenever you stop, a warning message will be displayed. If that happens don’t worry! Just follow the instructions on the screen.
Icon of an area to practice sport
That’s the end of the user testing.
Thank you for your time and contribution!
Very loud sound will be played after clicking the button.
Please speed up to continue the test.
Then click on the green button and finish the task.
Data couldn\'t be loaded, please go back and open the map again.
